text.section: Unless conducted at an event requiring a permit under subsection (a) of this section, a raffle is not a multiple gaming device regulated under this section.

section.section: In this subsection, "charity" means an organization, institution, association, society, or corporation that is exempt from taxation under § 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code.

text.section:
Before issuing a permit, the county commissioners shall determine that the organization seeking the permit:
is organized in and serves the residents of the county; and
meets the conditions of this subtitle.

section.section: Except as provided in subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph, a permit is valid for one event that does not last longer than 6 hours.
The county commissioners may issue a permit for an event longer than 6 hours if the permit holder does not seek more than one permit in the same year.
The county commissioners may not approve a permit for gaming events to be held on premises that are licensed under a Class B or Class D alcoholic beverages license.
The county commissioners may not issue more than two permits to an organization in a single year.

The county commissioners may:
charge a fee set by resolution for each permit;
set the number of permits that may be issued each year; and
adopt regulations governing permit applications and the issuance of permits.
Unless the county commissioners grant a waiver, only a resident of the county may manage and operate a fundraiser for which a permit is issued on behalf of the permit holder.
Each permit holder shall designate an individual to be responsible for compliance with the terms and conditions of this subtitle and a permit issued under this subtitle.
A person may not be compensated for operating the gaming activity conducted under a permit.
The permit holder shall use at least one-half of the funds raised using the permit for civic, charitable, or educational purposes.

Within 30 days after a fundraiser, the permit holder shall send to the county commissioners:
an accounting of all funds received or pledged;
an accounting of all expenses paid or incurred; and
a statement under oath of the application of the net profits.

text.section: The county commissioners may deny a permit for not more than 3 years to an organization that violates this subtitle or regulations adopted under this subtitle.
